reviews.text: A nice little place.  I‚Äôm maybe being a little harsh about the food.   I had pork shoulder w cabbage with a side of kielbasa.  The sausage and cabbage were respectable.  The pork shoulder was pretty gristly and not so flavorful.  But the place has a nice vibe and I will return to try other dishes.  It‚Äôs certainly great value for the money!  Whole meal with a drink was under $30.  Friendly staff.
Amazing polish food. The restaurant has a great vibe and good service. Tried a lot of dishes I‚Äôd never tried before and everything was amazing!
Authentic Polish, comfortable atmosphere. Would give it five stars for being exactly what I expected but it isn‚Äôt fine dining after all.

Je≈õli lubisz klimat Polski w Nowym Yorku to karczma jest dobrym miejscem. Prza≈õnie wiejsko i nieco obciachowo. Za to pomidorowa jest pyszna szarlotka r√≥wnie≈º i mo≈ºna pos≈Çuchaƒá polskiej mowy w wersji ameryka≈Ñskiej

My friend and I decided on this spot for our weekend meal. Their food tastes fresh and the menu has plenty of variety. The spotless interior and contemporary style impressed me. The service people were equally impressive. This place delivers on its reputation.

The high standards here apply to everything they do. Each plate showed masterful preparation. The menu includes multiple dish options. Their workers bring this restaurant to another level. Make sure this spot is your next dining choice.
Authentic delicious food. Everything was well prepared, service was great!
Pyszne jedzonko, sympatyczny staff i atmosfera. Porcje du≈ºe jak dla mnie wiec mo≈ºna sie nastawiƒá ze reszta bedzie na take away üôÉ
Whats not to love?!! Just about everything I have tried has been delicious!!

Place is definitely over hyped. Food is a hit or miss. Soups are good, you can taste they're cooked properly and without much powdered flavor additives. Light on the salt which is an easy fix. But the meats we had were all bone dry and pretty tasteless. Frozen fries and unimaginative sides make  it even worse. But the service really tips the scale. Robotic, careless, rushed. On the verge of impolite. Definitely wouldn't recommend this place to a friend.

The food is delicious, the atmosphere is friendly, and the service is quick and always with a smile. Overall, I highly recommend it to all.
You will LOve it!
Nina @ Ami
Wonderful place ü´∂
True Polish food in Greenpoint. Good food and good portions.

I ordered chicken noodle soup, but aside from carrots and noodles, there was nothing else in it. They didn‚Äôt put any chicken at all. The delivery website doesn‚Äôt list the ingredients, but for a small portion that costs $8, they could at least include some chicken

My wife and I heard about this great polish restaurant/ bar HOME COOKING, grandparents recipe made just like my mama cooked rest her soul, specifically soup ‚Äú. Flaczki ‚Äú.  and we all know it takes 3 days to prepare the right way, Fish and chips frytki sea style.  Baked potatoes on brick stove made us feel at home.  Hey come by and check it out for yourself
You like it‚Ä¶..ps. european kitchen with brew at your discretion
If you want to try Polish food that's amazing then look no further.
The best authentic Polish food in nyc. That‚Äôs for sure. Highly recommend!! I go there all the time!!
Very good polish food. Atmosphere is great.
Great
I'm Polish so I know what is polish kitchen and cuisine here is really polish type and very good
Super miejsce, jedna z lepszych polskich restauracji w Stanach. Smaczny ≈ºurek i schabowy. S≈Çaby sos w go≈ÇƒÖbkach, ale atmosferƒÖ nadrabiajƒÖ niedociƒÖgniƒôcia. Polecam!
Super tasty food
Can‚Äôt wait to come back for hunter‚Äôs stew, pierogis, and potatoes pancakes. The beef in the spicy beef goulash was excellent (not spicy btw).

If you haven‚Äôt been to Karczma it‚Äôs a MUST. Great Polish Restaurant with fantastic, attentive staff and food that makes you want to come back again and again. It‚Äôs over an hour drive for us to get here and always well worth the trip. Highly recommend the fried Oscypek.
Je≈õli kto≈õ ma dosyƒá ameryka≈Ñskiego, sztucznego jedzenia, kt√≥re nie nadaje siƒô do niczego - Karczma bƒôdzie idealna. Pyszne jedzenie i ≈ºo≈ÇƒÖdki Wam za to podziƒôkujƒÖ‚Ä¶ Polecam! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Incredible food, bug portions and very affordable
Always fantastic
Best Polish food in a neighborhood that has many. The Hunters Stew is outstanding as are the potatoes pancakes, soups and many other traditional dishes.

Karczma never lets me down. It‚Äôs one of the last true Polish spots left in Greenpoint, and it honestly feels like a little piece of home. Whenever I‚Äôm feeling homesick or just need some comfort, this is where I go for food that warms my soul. The meals are always tasty, portions are generous, and there‚Äôs always something good on the menu. Love this place!

I‚Äôm Polish so I know what means good quality Polish food ! And this is what you would find in Karczma ! I‚Äôm really impressed! Sour rye soup aka Zurek in a bread is to die for! We came back next day for more food . Highly recommend for everyone! Do zobaczenia next time !
Cudna restauracja bardzo blisko stacji metra. Obs≈Çuga mi≈Ça i bardzo szybka. Jedzenie bardzo sycƒÖce niedrogie i przesmaczne.
You can get a beer under $10! So many greats

Classic Polish restaurant featuring traditionally prepared dishes. We got the sampler and the Spicy Goulash. The sampler was perfect for 2 people trying to explore several tastes from the menu.  I wouldn't call it spicy, but it was delicious.
≈öwietne miejsce, pyszne jedzenie !
Incredibly delicious food. I was especially pleased with the white borscht in bread, very unusual, we also threw a coin into a special things in the middle to return back here .
Love love love this place!
Spacious seat in a Polish themed restaurant. Food is served quickly and sticks to original Polish recipes. Service is attentive and kind. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Greepoint.

We had a great lunch üòã here , we were literally the first guests[ who arrived just a bit early before they opened the doors ] Everything from the staff to the quality and taste of the meals were amazing üëè
Najlepsze jedzenie w Stanach! Bardzo polecam
I had a fantastic Polish lunch today for $17. White borscht with mashed potatoes and bacon. Then a pork cutlet with mushrooms and cabbage.
best polish food in town! authentic and delicious
The food was amazing the atmosphere was great and the beer list was amazing as well.

Pretty disappointed. I don‚Äôt eat Polish food often, but I remembered coming here years ago and thought I‚Äôd give it another try since I was in the neighborhood. It started off well‚Äîthe tripe soup was actually really good.

But the Plate of Polish Specialties was a letdown. It came with three pierogis, two potato pancakes, kielbasa, hunter‚Äôs stew, and stuffed cabbage. Sounds great, right? But the cabbage was way too salty and not even hot in the middle. Honestly felt like it was leftover from the day before. The stew was even saltier‚Äîhow do you mess up stew?

The kielbasa was tasty but such a tiny portion. The pierogis were fried and just okay. The one highlight? The potato pancakes. Crispy, hot, and really flavorful.

Also, they charged me $0.75 for extra sour cream. Come on. Between that and the salty food, I‚Äôm not coming back.
Great food and price

Polska restauracja w stylu karczmy. Wystrojona jak w skansenie, trochƒô ciemno w ≈õrodku. Obs≈Çuga ogarniƒôta, ale bez tego ameryka≈Ñskiego podej≈õcia. Jedzenie smaczne. Zam√≥wi≈Çem flaki, kt√≥re by≈Çy pyszne, jednak kto≈õ nie ≈ºa≈Çowa≈Ç pieprzu. Kotlet schodowy by≈Ç du≈ºy i te≈º smakowa≈Ç wybornie. M√≥j przyjaciel zam√≥wi≈Ç baraninƒô. Pr√≥bowa≈Çem i by≈Ço to niebo w gƒôbie. Ceny ok, niezbyt wysokie, ale te≈º nie najni≈ºsze. Za dwie osoby razem z tipem, sokiem owocowym i piwem zap≈Çacili≈õmy $80
My friend and I love coming to this restaurant.  Not only you can try authentic Polish food, but also the rates are hard to beat. The best kebabs, salads and amazing ice cold Polish beer!!!
Food is super authentic and solid in all aspects. It was a busy night so service was lacking. Waitress only came around twice but the food was good enough to make up for it.

Zam√≥wi≈Çem golonkƒô pieczonƒÖ w piwie w smaku by≈Ça nawet ok ale by≈Ça nie dogotowane miƒôso nie odrywa≈Ço siƒô od ko≈õci i bardzo ciƒô≈ºko siƒô kroi≈Ço, ziemniaki i bigos by≈Çy ca≈Çkiem niez≈Çe, dla kogo≈õ kto przyjecha≈Ç na wakacje i tƒôskni za polskƒÖ kuchniƒÖ to spoko.

Food was absolutely delicious üëçüòã and the quality was excellent, and quantity abundant. You get a great deal for your money. They also serve wine, beer, and liquor. Parking may be a little challenging if coming in  by car üöó . All in all, it was a great experience.
Just what I was looking for.   Loved the white borscht.  Excellent hunters stew, stuffed cabbage and potatoes.  Excellent carrot salad.

First time trying Polish food, and Karczma made a solid impression. I‚Äôm still dreaming about the asparagus wrapped in bacon, easily the highlight. The sausages were super flavorful too. The location is super convenient, right by the train, and the cozy, rustic decor totally reminded me of a restaurant I visited in Prague years ago

We really loved the vibes, but the service left a lot to be desired. Maybe they‚Äôre going for that classic European service style but, this is NYC, and when the check comes with a suggested 20% tip, expectations are a little higher. We felt nervous to ask for water because our server seemed to have her bad day by our interaction, she never filled our glass didn‚Äôt check in at all after taking the order that she didn't realize we were missing one dish. The person who seemed to be busser helped pour us water and got our missing dish checked. Not ideal.

That said, the food and atmosphere were great, and we‚Äôd definitely consider coming back if we‚Äôre in the neighborhood.
Pierogis were amazing. All the meats, potatoes, sauces, and cabbage were incredible. Simple food, but delicious. Lots of food as well. Great atmosphere and service.

Lovely vibe, my in-law is Polish and he has been craving for some good polish foods, this definitely didn‚Äôt disappoint! The ham hock is amazing, perfectly cooked, firm and tender. We also love the pierogi with cheese and potato filling.

I recently enjoyed an incredible Polish meal featuring a hearty plate for two persons filled with bacon, salmon, blood sausage, and traditional Polish kielbasa, all perfectly cooked and flavorful. The baked potatoes were a comforting side, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Pairing the meal with a refreshing draft beer completed the experience.
The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a relaxed evening with my friend. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic Polish flavors in a cozy setting, this place is a must-visit! Thank you‚ù§Ô∏è

The dine in experience is lovely, but it's also an excellent place to order for delivery if you have a craving for Polish food. The Plate of Polish Specialties (which includes pierogis, stuffed cabbage, kielbasa, hunter stew and potato pancakes) is my standard order, but their other options like Pickle Soup, which are hard to find elsewhere, are wonderful too.

My big bro is Polish, and almost gave me a knuckle sandwich when I said that Polish food is just a little bland. He said we had to try Karczma in Greenpoint, as it‚Äôs his favorite Polish restaurant in the city.

We sat down in the rustic farmhouse interior while live Polish music played in the background. As I‚Äôve gotten older, these are the nights that I‚Äôve learned to appreciate more. A nice Friday night dinner with the homies, where the stressful work week feels like a distant memory. It‚Äôs a good antidote to the vicious cycles of self loathing or ‚Äúwhat am I doing with my life‚Äù that can sometimes consume me.

The Polish homie ordered an authentic Polish dinner for us. Our feast for the 3 of us consisted of Hand made perogies, grilled plate for 3, Spicy beef Goulash, Traditional pork cutlet, herring in cream, potato pancakes, and roasted hocks in beer.

I‚Äôm used to portion sizes at places in New York to be TINY, but these were enormous. We lowkey got mogged by all this food. The bang for your buck in here is INSANE. My favorites were the Mix grilled plate and the roasted hocks.

That mixed grilled plate for ‚Äú3‚Äù is really for 5 GROWN men. So much meat. It was so damn good though, the bacon and chicken went crazy.

The roasted hocks is the shank portion of the pig's hind leg, and came with a big steak knife in it. It was rich and had a smoky flavor, and was so damn tender. Definitely get the roasted hocks if you come.

On the other end of the spectrum, the herring in cream was just not for me. Was the fishiest fish I've ever tasted, but I'll try anything once.

$60 each after tip was SO reasonable for this feast we had. I gotta start putting more respect on Polish food, that‚Äôs on me‚Ä¶

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

I went to this restaurant because of the great reviews and my love for pierogis, but I have to be honest‚ÄîI wasn‚Äôt impressed. Quite the contrary.

I ordered the Polish plate, and overall, everything lacked salt. The pierogis were very bland, and I couldn‚Äôt even tell what the fillings were. I believe there were three different kinds, but only the potato one was somewhat identifiable. The potato pancakes were completely tasteless‚Äîto the point where I honestly wondered if they had forgotten to buy salt!! The stuffed cabbage wasn‚Äôt any better. The only item with any flavor was the meat stew.

I also sat at the counter, squeezed between the beer dispenser (literally in my face, see photo) and a very odd customer who started to make me uncomfortable. The bartender clearly noticed, but didn‚Äôt offer to move me even when other seats at the counter became available.

Overall, the experience felt cold and unwelcoming. It was probably the first time I‚Äôve ever dined somewhere without being asked how the food was or whether I needed anything else. No one even said goodbye when I got up to leave.

First and last time!!
Go to Pierozek! Much better.

Loved this place.  It's one of the few Polish restaurants still remaining in Greenpoint.  The place is roomy and has nice decor.  It even has a wishing well.  They have a. Lunch Special that comes with your choice of soup.  I tried White Borscht for the first time and it was very good.  I has the Pork Cutlet which comes with Cabbage and Mashed Potatoes.  I asked for Sauerkraut instead of Cabbage.  The Pork Cutlet was the size of my head.  All this was just $16.  The service is good and the prices are very reasonable.
Delicious food, great service and environment. I recommend Stuffed Cabbage, pickle soup and hunters stew.
Very tasty food, traditional Polish dishes. The beer is cold and delicious, the portions are very large and hearty. We liked everything, we will definitely return to this amazing restaurant!

If you want to try Polish cuisine, this is a good place in NYC. There are not many Polish restaurants left. I haven't visited this place for a long time and I noticed some changes for the better (probably the cook changed). I recommend the white borscht in bread, it's good and worth trying. The service is nice and During the week you don't have to wait long for a table. You can also get a beer or a drink and eat outside.

I loved this place as it took me back to Central Europe with its vibe and atmosphere!

We came here with friends on recommendation and enjoyed every little bit of our experience. The staff was friendly, attentive, witty and with a great sense of humor, which is, for me, a good first sign of a customer-oriented restaurant.

The variety of European beers was huge, mainly Polish beers, but I was ecstatic when I found Czech Pilsner on the menu! However the local delicacy is the hot cider with cinnamon and red mulled wine - typically served during winter months but here I was able to enjoy it in the middle of March!

The food was great, really well prepared and the way it is supposed to be (at least in Europe). It is truly original central European cuisine! The white borscht in bread was delicious despite the fact it was a rather small portion, but the Roasted Hocks in beer was huge! And super tasty, like I said, original to its core.

I found the prices of meals and drinks very reasonable - main dishes were between $15 to $20. Toilets were clean and tidy despite the fact the restaurant was crowded.

Overall if you want to try Polish food, come here, you wont regret it. I know I will come back! Paid by card. Visited in March 2023.

Sat at the bar on a Friday night without any reservations.  Majority of customers seemed to be regulars and they were speaking to the staff in polish! Tried the polish combo with pierogi, stuffed cabbage, tomato and sausage stew which was my favorite. Also ordered six pierogis. Reasonably priced and delicious comfort food. Definitely coming back to try out other dishes and drinks!

We arrived at noon and there was no wait for a party of 7 without a reservation. We ordered the grilled plate for three, plate of polish specialties, stuffed cabbage, hunters stew, roasted hocks, and white borscht.

I really enjoyed the plate of polish specialties because it is a sizable portion of all the things you should try. The grilled plate for three was also a good opportunity to try the different types of meat. I didn't think I would enjoy the stuffed cabbage, but it had a light flavor with really tasty tomato sauce. The white borscht was also delicious. The roasted hocks were solid. I wasn't a fan of the hunters stew because it had a sour taste.

The amount of food you get for the price is insane. This restaurant offers incredible value. My only complaint is that the food was really salty and I was constantly drinking water, eating the mashed potatoes, and using the sauces to cut the saltiness.

Karczma has been around for a while, offering one of the most authentic Polish dining experiences. I‚Äôve practically sampled everything on the menu.

The white borsch served in a bread bowl is pure comfort‚Äîcreamy, rich, and hearty. You can‚Äôt go wrong with the hunter‚Äôs bacon, a thick-cut, grilled delight paired with perfectly charred grilled onions‚Äîit‚Äôs a classic. The grilled asparagus wrapped in ham is another solid option. While I enjoy the salmon tartare, I‚Äôm not a fan of the oversized capers it‚Äôs served with, but you can easily pick them out.

If you‚Äôre new to Polish cuisine, start with the Plate of Specialties‚Äîit‚Äôs a great introduction. It includes pan-fried pierogies, crispy and flaky potato pancakes, grilled kielbasa, and stuffed cabbage filled with rice and meat, all smothered in tomato sauce (though that‚Äôs not my top pick here).

For a healthier option, the grilled salmon with dill sauce is fantastic and highly recommended. On the other hand, the roasted hocks in beer is a hefty portion but a bit too fatty for my taste.
Fantastyczne miejsce!!! Pyszne jedzenie, porcje du≈ºe, obs≈Çuga bardzo mi≈Ça. Polecam serdecznie ka≈ºdemu kto odwiedziƒá planuje Greenpoint!!!

Najlepsza restauracja na Greenpoint i w Nowym Jorku. Jedzenie pyszne, ≈õwie≈ºe. Byli≈õmy 2 razy i nie mogƒô narzekaƒá na nic. Porcje sƒÖ ogromne, kelnerka kt√≥ra nas obs≈Çugiwa≈Ça bardzo mi≈Ça. Polecam ka≈ºdemu kto chcia≈Çby zje≈õƒá pyszny polski obiad na obczy≈∫nie. ‚ô•Ô∏è

Ostatnia wizyta w Karczmie na Greenpoincie by≈Ça prawdziwƒÖ ucztƒÖ dla podniebienia. Restauracja ta, znana z autentycznej polskiej kuchni, po raz kolejny udowodni≈Ça, ≈ºe jest prawdziwym ambasadorem smak√≥w naszej tradycji kulinarnej.
Na poczƒÖtek zam√≥wi≈Çem Tatar wo≈Çowy ‚Äì klasyczny, perfekcyjnie przygotowany. Miƒôso by≈Ço najwy≈ºszej jako≈õci, delikatne, a jednocze≈õnie pe≈Çne smaku. Do tego doskona≈Çe dodatki  min: kapary ,≈º√≥≈Çtko ,cebulka , kt√≥re idealnie zwiƒÖza≈Ço ca≈Ço≈õƒá. Ka≈ºdy kƒôs by≈Ç niczym podr√≥≈º do polskiego domu ‚Äì prawdziwy majstersztyk.Nastƒôpnie przysz≈Ça pora na Golonkƒô w piwie, kt√≥ra okaza≈Ça siƒô prawdziwƒÖ gwiazdƒÖ wieczoru. Miƒôso by≈Ço tak miƒôkkie, ≈ºe niemal samo odchodzi≈Ço od ko≈õci, a sk√≥rka ‚Äì chrupiƒÖca, idealnie wypieczona. Sos na bazie piwa mia≈Ç g≈Çƒôboki, bogaty smak z lekkƒÖ nutƒÖ karmelu, kt√≥ra piƒôknie podkre≈õla≈Ça soczysto≈õƒá miƒôsa. Porcja by≈Ça imponujƒÖca, a do tego podano tradycyjne dodatki ‚Äì kapustƒô zasma≈ºanƒÖ i ziemniaki, kt√≥re dope≈Çni≈Çy ca≈Çe danie.Atmosfera w Karczmie by≈Ça r√≥wnie wyjƒÖtkowa ‚Äì rustykalne wnƒôtrze, przyjemna muzyka i serdeczna obs≈Çuga sprawi≈Çy, ≈ºe czu≈Çem siƒô jak w prawdziwej polskiej karczmie.
Ponadto w restauracji serwowane jest wy≈õmienite piwo z nalewaka jak: ≈ªywiec Niemieckie HB oraz Czeski Pilsner.
Je≈õli jeste≈õ w Nowym Jorku i tƒôsknisz za polskimi smakami, Karczma na Greenpoincie to miejsce, kt√≥re musisz odwiedziƒá. Golonka w piwie i tatar wo≈Çowy to pozycje obowiƒÖzkowe ‚Äì polecam rownie≈º Flaki. Gwarantujƒô, ≈ºe nie po≈ºa≈Çujesz!

Such a great place with delicious food. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Portions were so generous, we had to take some of it back with us. Definitely a must try for some authentic Polish food. Dziƒôkujƒô ‚ù§Ô∏è

Delicious polish food. The name translates to roadside eatery - and the cuisine here is hearty and comforting. The flavors of the heavier meatier dishes are balanced perfectly with the carrot horseradish salad, Sauerkraut, beet salad, etc. Welcoming service. Large booths. Great bear on draft. Full bar. Perfect for a hearty, comfort food meal.

It has its own atmosphere, but the food is not great, I don't know what there is to admire about Polish cuisine in an average edition. It is also not the cheapest, but I recommend it to anyone who likes it or Such places and Polish cuisine. Although for Polish cuisine I recommend flying to Poland xD or visiting Polish friends who can cook their traditional dishes, not burnt pork chops

This place was very good! Let‚Äôs start with the ambiance, though over the top, it was fun. Their polish food was very good and had large portions. I grew up on many of these dishes and it is always worth the trip to Greenpoint. The staff was also friendly and attentive. Especially the male server with the blonde coloured hair whose name I believe starts with a g. Sorry, I forget names often but not faces. Will definitely go back when he is there.

I highly recommend this place for anyone who enjoys good food.

The best place for authentic polish food! Whenever I miss home and my moms food, I‚Äôm going here. Great lunch offer (soup and main dish for around $15), great pierogies, white borscht in bread. Stuffed cabbage wasn‚Äôt my favorite, maybe I was comparing it to my moms food too much üòÇ
But basically when I miss home, I‚Äôm just going there.

An authentic Polish restaurant with a typical decoration and  Polish music.
The selection of beers and drinks is excellent and the menu is varied,  we really enjoyed the food even though some of the dishes were a bit salty for our‚Ä¶

A very nice Polish restaurant that offers an excellent selection of Polish home dishes.
Here you can find hot and cold snacks and main dishes that taste like prepared by our grandmothers at home.
Very nice atmosphere of the restaurant which owes its waitress who are always smiling and kindly serving the customer.
I especially recommend hot beer and wine which is very popular in Poland during the winter.
Definitely I do recommend come here and try polnish food's.

Smacznego

This is one of my favorite spots when I‚Äôm craving Polish food. Just stepping in here is like traveling to Poland, between the homey decor and all the staff speaking Polish to one another. All the food is excellent - covering all the traditional Polish menu items one would expect. It‚Äôs also a great value and very very filling. I guarantee you‚Äôll not leave this place hungry!

Came here on a Friday night. I ordered the plate for two. It's a lot of food. All the chicken, steak, and sausage was great. Bacon was a little salty. I also ordered the polish specialties.  That was great too. They had a performance,  two guys singing and playing a woodwind instrument.  I would definitely come back. Everything was awesome.  Nice decor. We got our food quickly.  Lots of tables. Service was excellent.

You can't go wrong by coming here for some authentic Polish meal at a really good value. If there is a wait, start your meal by the bar; they will be happy to move you to a table later.

The cocktail list was very interesting - while they were tasty, they all tend to be on the sweeter side (Karczma's Apple Pie, Nutcracker, Greenpoint).

The two of us shared the following: White Borscht, Plate of Polish Specialties, Grilled Blood Sausage, and Cucumber Salad. The portions were very generous, so start small to not over overstuff yourself. Everything was delicious, and we were so glad to find a well made blood sausage dish in NYC.

üá¨üáß I recommend the restaurant "Karczma" to everyone
Nice Polish restaurant with a very nice atmosphere - you can feel like in Poland.
Food very delicious.
My dumplings were tasty
like at grandma's.
The pork chop was super tasty.
I'd rather just order anything from the menu.
Staff speaking natural Polish and English.
Prices are ok for New York.
You can pay by credit card.
It's worth it!
10/10

Coming to this restaurant is a Family Tradition going back to my childhood. It was so nostalgic to walk through the doors. The atmosphere & Decor still authentic!! The food is AMAZING....everyone's dinner was absolutely DELICIOUS!! Wish I lived closer so I could go more often!! 10 out 10 Recommend this Restaurant!!
